title: Man sexually assaulted stranger in street after girlfriend refused sex with him
text:

A holidaymaker has been jailed for sexually assaulting a stranger in the street after leaving his girlfriend in bed when she refused to have sex with him.

Adam Robakowski, 31, was on holiday when he became frustrated after his partner spurned his advances.

He tried to find a sex worker but failed, so instead he sexually attacked a stranger on the street in Newquay, Cornwall.

Appearing at Truro Crown Court, Robakowski was jailed for 14 years of which he must serve a minimum of nine, and will only be released when is deemed to be no longer a risk.

Robakowski, from Sheffield, Yorkshire, committed the crime in June 2016, after he left his hotel between 5am and 6am.

He was charged with assault by penetration and denied the charge, but was found guilty by a jury following a trial.

The trial hear how Robakowski told his then girlfriend, with whom he was staying in a hotel in Newquay, that he was going out for some air.

However, it later emerged that prior to leaving the hotel shortly before the attack he had been contacting phone numbers linked to local prostitutes.

He then stalked one woman walking home from a night out before targeting the victim, who cannot be named for legal reasons.

In a victim personal statement read to the courts, the victim described being affected significantly by the attack.

She says she is now jumpy, always flinches at things, doesn't trust people and hates having people standing behind her.

She said in the statement: "It's had a huge effect on my mental health and I suffer from psychosis, anxiety and depression which I did not before this happened.

"I've started seeing things in the street such as men in hoodies and my mood swings have been atrocious. I had to quit my job as I felt I couldn't work.

"I have to live with the paranoia and mistrust of men. It's a lonely trip."

Representing Robakowski, Rupert Taylor said he doesn't accept he was the perpetrator and is a man of no relevant previous convictions.

Sentencing Robakoawki, Judge Simon Carr said: "The attack was persistent and she fought back the best she could. She got away and you attacked her again.

"The one single thing that stopped the attack was that your keys and phone fell out of your pocket. You returned to the hotel room occupied by your partner as if nothing happened.

"The effect on the victim has been devastating and stranger attacks of this sort are exceptionally rare. Those who carry them out are exceptionally dangerous.

(Image: Getty Images)

"You continue to deny and minimise the offence you committed and present a high-risk of sexual violence to women and will for the rest of your life."

Judge Carr then passed an extended sentence of 14 years, meaning Robakowski must serve a minimum of nine years in custody but then will only be released when a parole board deems him to no longer be a danger.
description: Adam Robakowski, 31, tried to find a sex worker but failed, so he sexually attacked a stranger in Newquay, Cornwall
